comments.body: @benstevens48 looks good, but could you add a test?
It could be useful to have an enum type

When you say an enum type do you mean a proper enum type with string literals or do you mean one like the ones written in the rest of this definition files (type aliases)? I didn't want to overload it with too many types, but I don't mind either way.
Yep, I'd prefer an enum, not those type aliases

https://github.com/basarat/typescript-book/blob/master/docs/styleguide/styleguide.md#namespace

I know the other ones do not follow that convention, it could be good to change them too

I don't want to change the existing ones as that will break backwards compatibility. I wasn't sure if this namespace is necessary or not. Do you think it makes it a bit cumbersome to import the types? I could just not have an extra interface for the payment request stuff. What do you think?
I like the namespace, it's true that the change will break backwards compatibility for existing namespaces, let's leave it in camelCase üëç
